cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday afternoon/evening, then sweep across south-central Georgia and coastal South Carolina before moving offshore and racing NE just off the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola–Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (includes Savannah area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL on the Gulf Coast and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL on the Atlantic Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, northeast Florida, Georgia, and coastal Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (peak 40–50 mph gusts) early Tuesday as the center passes inland just SW of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally ≤2 ft) possible around high-tide due to onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 8-inch pockets; flooding of low-lying port areas possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes Monday night–Tuesday, rough seas and high surf affecting vessel operations
